reviews.text: The Good: Very good and strategic location. Quite clean and cheap.
reviews.title: Cheap but....

reviews.text: The Bad: The room is not soundproof... you can hear cars honking or passing by almost all night long. (we stayed on the 6th floor!) And there was a construction going on several buildings away. The noise was unbearable. The room had a very strong bleach smell when we first entered. Noisy and creaking beds.
reviews.title: Best for a budget break...

reviews.text: If budget is not a problem, I wouldn't recommend this place. Otherwise, you might want to ask for a room that's not facing the main street.
reviews.title: Great lockation, Horrible Beds

reviews.text: This little, friendly hotel is ideally located right next to the Gateway into Chinatown and within easy walking distance of Union Square and various bus routes to get you around the city. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful and the rooms clean. There are phones in the rooms but no internet, however there is a really nice internet cafe a few blocks down and starbucks opposite for those with laptops! The hotel also offers a shuttle to the airport which will pick up at any time. This hotel is really good value for money (only a little more expensive for 2 people than a hostel) and def better value than many of the other hostels which try and charge you 4 times as much for very few extras. When I return to San Francisco I would def stay here.
reviews.title: Fantastically located, bargain hotel!
Responsiveness and Hospitality
reviews.text: P.S. The lift is a little dodgy- think of the film Thoroughly Modern Millie and you'll know what I mean!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Astoria in May 2007, so we knew what to expect this year.
reviews.title: We Love the Hotel Astoria in Stresa.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Astoria delivered wonderful accommodations for the second year in a row. The management was so thoughtful as to give us the same huge room as we had last May. Our room was on a high floor with a balcony overlooking Lake Maggiore.
reviews.title: fantastic family owned hotel

reviews.text: The pool area in the rear is "somewhat" small, but in perfect proportion to the hotel and the property. The size of the pool is large and thankfully heated. Food and drinks can be ordered poolside and there are tables with umbrellas where you can eat.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great food -- and a mean, nasty staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for something inexpensive in the city that was safe. We didn't need frills. This was perfect. There is a parking garage directly across the street. The room had a walk in closet and cute bathroom. There was plenty of room. The hotel was nice in a San Fanncisco old-style way. The elevator was scary. It lurched about. We usually took the stairs. The staff is very friendly. We'd stay there again.
reviews.title: Good rates and location

likes.disliked: — we had to walk up three flights of stairs. good exercise.

reviews.text: There wasn't any air conditioning when we stayed there, so if it's very hot, I'd check with staff before booking. We were fine with open windows. The view of the city is also nice.
reviews.title: saves money, excellent location, good for last-minute travellers (like me)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, consider this: I got really low rates at official website [-], paid $57 a night, with private bath and complimentary breakfast, it's below the cheapest options in the city!!! You may take an even cheaper room if you choose shared bath ($45), but I couldn't see the shared bath myself, so I can't make an opinion about it. I was really happy to find room in SF, most places were already sold out.
reviews.title: Good bargain for location if all you need is a place to stay

likes.disliked: — Nothing, it was what I expected

reviews.text: Now, let's face it: with this low rate, I could not really expect much. But I actually enjoyed it, cos it has such a fabulous location. I got from the airport by Bart and the hotel is only four blocks from Montgomery station.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.text: Now the problems: The bathroom was really tiny, I don't think fat people will be able to reach the sink, sorry. The whole building is managed by a Chinese family, who barely speak English (but Keep that in mind and you will be fine). The room was sort of clean, but after we left, we've notice our clothes got some terrible smell... like old wet carpet. The room had a strange smell indeed. But first impression was that room was clean.
reviews.title: Good Budget Option- Great Location

reviews.text: Great location and good price. The rooms were clean and had everything one needs. The price is right.
reviews.title: Good value!!
Warm welcome, great location
reviews.text: Stayed at the Astoria for 1 week in early January 2005 and we were really impressed with the quality and service of this small family run hotel. In terms of location, the hotel is right in the centre of Jasper with a good quality pub and restaurant within the hotel, a pizza place and ski hire shop on either side, the town centre within 5 min walking distance and the ski bus stop right outside the front door. Before arriving, had looked at other higher graded hotels in the town but this hotel provided everything that we were looking for and the bed was so comfortable which was great after a day snowboarding! Our room overlooked the main road outside but this was not a problem as the traffic was minimal during the night and the windows are well glazed. Due to 1 evening of bad weather during our stay we did not wish to go outside so walked down 1 flight of stairs to the De'd Dog pub where we had a good night with reasonably priced food and drink and a good atmosphere, but not really noisy. A really comfortable stay - highly recommended.

At the right price this basic hotel is good, honest value for money. Staff are friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Compared well with 5 other hotels we stayed in throughout the rockies. Quaint, not luxurious, what you see is what you get and they deliver all they promise, unlike a couple of the so-called luxury hotels. Our room was not large not small, basically clean (a bottle top & lolly wrapper under the bed). Quiet with triple glazed windows.
reviews.title: We quite liked the Astoria

reviews.text: I've stayed in $30 motels that were better than this place. We stayed here because everything else in town was booked for our date of arrival. I'd have been happier sleeping in the car and saving the money. The room was tiny and grim. The window opened which kept the temperature in the liveable range, but the screen was bent so offered no barrier to the local insect population. The view was of the roof and the laundry hanging out next door. Not what you might hope for in one of the most beautiful areas in the world. This place is a flophouse with luxury prices.
reviews.title: $30 Value for $200
Disliked the Astoria
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Astoria Hotel in Jasper, on August 24, 2005. It was the most overpriced hotel I have ever experienced. For $196 Canadian, we got a tiny room barely big enough for the king sized bed. The bed was too short for my husband (6foot3inches tall), and so soft he had a backache the next day. There was no AC, but fortunately the fan and open window made the temperature bearable. The bathroom was tiny, smelled of mold and the shower ran hot and cool. According to a local ad, this hotel "has been recently renovated." I would hate to see what it was like before, because the room was rather shabby and the hallway carpets were literally threadbare. We moved to another hotel -- Park Place Inn -- for two more nights in Jasper, and for $5 more Canadian, received a wonderful value. I will avoid the Astoria on any future visits because it is a huge rip-off.

I stayed at the Astoria in July 2004. The hotel was in a great location, right on one of the main streets. The rooms were clean and comfortable although a little small. There were many great restaurants and shops nearby. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again if I returned to Jasper.
reviews.title: A Nice, Centrally Located Hotel!

reviews.text: My brand new wife and I arrived here for two nights on our honeymoon, with a reservation for a double room. We were somewhat shocked to find that the room we'd been given was actually a dingy little twin room with two single beds, and a spectacular view onto a brick wall five feet away from the window.
reviews.title: Indifferent service

reviews.text: I stayed recently at the Astoria for 8 nights, so maybe it´s a good reference in terms of experience.
reviews.title: Good choice !!!

reviews.text: First, the location: very good! It is near of some touristic points and from several bus lines. At the corner of Bush and Grant (easy to find after coming from the airport by BART (wich is the cheapiest way to get out of the airport and reach the center of the city, in case, Powel Station).
reviews.title: Hotel Astoria - great value for the price

reviews.text: Second, the rooms: clean. Towels were changed every day, bed clothes ok. The furniture were old, but no problem. Mattress was very comfortable. The shower, you can choose water so hot, cold or so-so as you want. There was a safe, but I did´t used it. TV was old too, and few channels had good image, but I wasn´t travelling to spend time with TV... There was no closed wardrobe (but it makes easier to not forget clothes). Everything was quiet (my room didn´t face the street).
reviews.title: what I was looking for and then some
No better place to crash
reviews.text: The breakfast had milk, orange juice, coffee, bread, muffins, bagels, cream cheese, jelly, butter, toaster, microwave oven, and you can eat as much as you want.
If you want internet connection you must go to the reception room because there was no wi-fi.
reviews.title: Good value for the budget-minded traveler

likes.disliked: — No clock radio, no wireless access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the astoria has a fantastic location, right next to the gate to China town and only a 5 to 10 minute walk to union square, and the location cannot be beaten for the price. the rooms are basic, and a bit dated, but clean, good shower, TV, etc. breakfast in a communal kitchen room with HUGE muffins, and unlimited toast, OJ, coffee, tea and muffins that will definitely fill you up for the day. if you are looking for a cheap stay in the centre of san fran and you arent looking for luxury then stay here!
reviews.title: brill location, basic but clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advise to anyone on a limited budget - or anyone who would rather spend their cash on sightseeing and eating out in this wonderful city should definetly consider staying at Hotel Astoria.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great hotel

reviews.text: The check in was fast and easy, the counter staff were helpful and polite. We checked into our room which although basic and the decor a little tired, was clean and quiet with a great powerful shower and a safe.
reviews.title: Needs complete remodelling

reviews.text: The breakfast was included in the exceptionally resonable room rates and was more than enough to keep you going until lunch. There are HUGE muffins and bagels - lots of different flavours, bread to make yourself toast and fresh orange juice, coffee and tea. I really dont know why anyone complains about it! We thought it was great.
reviews.title: OK hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the location - for the price it is brilliant. Right near the shops, union sqaure, chinatown. Everywhere downtown is easily within walking distance. Its also on the main road and felt completely safe - always people around. There is also a very handy corner store accross the road if you need any fruit/water/beer etc.
reviews.title: Great Deal For The Price
